metadata.title: CVE-2022-48564 on Ubuntu 22.04 LTS (jammy) - medium
metadata.description:
read_ints in plistlib.py in Python through 3.9.1 is vulnerable to apotential DoS attack via CPU and RAM exhaustion when processing malformedApple Property List files in binary format.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2022-48564` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

idle-python3.10 - 3.10.12-1~22.04.2
libpython3.10 - 3.10.12-1~22.04.2
libpython3.10-minimal - 3.10.12-1~22.04.2
libpython3.10-stdlib - 3.10.12-1~22.04.2
libpython3.10-testsuite - 3.10.12-1~22.04.2
python3.10 - 3.10.12-1~22.04.2
python3.10-examples - 3.10.12-1~22.04.2
python3.10-full - 3.10.12-1~22.04.2
python3.10-minimal - 3.10.12-1~22.04.2
python3.10-nopie - 3.10.12-1~22.04.2
python3.10-venv - 3.10.12-1~22.04.2
No subscription required

idle-python3.11 - 3.11.0~rc1-1~22.04
libpython3.11 - 3.11.0~rc1-1~22.04
libpython3.11-minimal - 3.11.0~rc1-1~22.04
libpython3.11-stdlib - 3.11.0~rc1-1~22.04
libpython3.11-testsuite - 3.11.0~rc1-1~22.04
python3.11 - 3.11.0~rc1-1~22.04
python3.11-examples - 3.11.0~rc1-1~22.04
python3.11-full - 3.11.0~rc1-1~22.04
python3.11-minimal - 3.11.0~rc1-1~22.04
python3.11-nopie - 3.11.0~rc1-1~22.04
python3.11-venv - 3.11.0~rc1-1~22.04
No subscription required

criterions.comment: python2.7 package in jammy is affected and may need fixing.
python3.10 package in jammy, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '3.10.12-1~22.04.2').
python3.11 package in jammy, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '3.11.0~rc1-1~22.04').
